Text.Language: <ere y/eymeh n~h~mot: ]paryenoc n~atywleb: pikumillion etcwtp: n~te ]oikoumen/ t/rc.
Hail to you, O full of grace, / the undefiled virgin, / the chosen vessel / for all the world.

Pilampac n~at[eno: p~sousou n~te ]paryenia: piervei n~atbwl e~bol: ouoh pis~bwt n~te pinah].
The ever-burning lamp, / the pride of virginity, / the indestructible sanctuary, / and the scepter of faith.

Ma]ho m~v/etaremacf: Penc#w#r# n~a~gayoc: n~tefw~li n~naiqici e~bolharon: n~tefcemni nan n~tefhir/n/.
Ask our good Savior / whom you gave birth to, / to deliver us from these hardships / and settle His peace upon us.

<ere y/eymeh n~h~mot: ]lu,nia n~kayaroc: y/e~tacfai qa pilampac: pi,~rwm n~te ]meynou].
Hail to you O full of grace, / the pure lampstand / which carries the lamp, / the fire of divinity.
Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ù„Ùƒ ÙŠØ§Ù…Ù…ØªÙ„Ø¦Ø© Ù†Ø¹Ù…Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ù†Ø§Ø±Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù†Ù‚ÙŠØ© Ø­Ø§Ù…Ù„Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…ØµØ¨Ø§Ø­ Ù†Ø§Ø± Ø§Ù„Ù„Ø§Ù‡ÙˆØª.
<ere ]helpic n~oujai: n~te ]oikoumen/ t/rc: eyb/] gar anerremhe: e~bolha picahoui n~te Eua.
Hail to you, the hope / of salvation of the world. / Because of you, we were / liberated from Eve's curse.

Eyb/] on anerman~swpi: m~Pip#n#a# e#y#u#: vai e~tafi~ e~h~r/i e~jw: afera~gia~zin m~mo.
Also, because of you, / we became the dwelling / of the Holy Spirit / who came on you and sanctified you.

<ere y/e~ta Gabri/l: er,eretizin m~moc: je ,ere y/eymeh n~h~mot: ouoh Po#c# sop neme.
Hail to whom Gabriel / greeted saying: / Hail to you O full of grace; / the Lord is with you.

For the Fatherâ€™s pleasure / was in your pregnancy / and the appearance of the Son / was in your womb.

The Holy Spirit / filled every part of you, / your soul and your body, / O Mary the Mother of God.

Eybe vai tenersai hwn: qen ousai m~p#n#a#tikon: ouoh m~p~rov/tikon eucop: enws e~bol nem p~ouro Dauid.
For this, we also / celebrate a spiritual / and prophetic feast, / proclaiming with King David.

Je twnk Po#c# e~pekm~ton: n~yok nem ]kibwtoc: n~te pima e#y#u# n~tak: e~te n~yo te w~ Maria.
Saying: Arise, O Lord, into your rest, / You, and the ark / of Your holy place / which is you O Mary.

<ere y/eymeh n~h~mot: ]paryenoc n~atywleb: ]c~k/n/ n~aymounk n~jij: pia~ho n~te ]meym/i.
Hail to you O full of grace, / the undefiled virgin / the dome not made with hands, / the treasure of righteousness.

<ere ][rompi eynecwc: y/e~tachisennoufi nan: n~]hir/n/ n~te V]: y/e~tacswpi sa nirwmi.
Hail to the beautiful dove / who announced to us / the peace of God / which has been given to men.

<ere y~mau m~v/etaferrwmi: qen pefouws m~min m~mof: nem p~]ma] m~Pefiwt: nem Pip#n#a# e#y#u#.
Hail to the mother of the Incarnate / by His own will, / and the pleasure of His Father / and the Holy Spirit.

<ere pic~tamnoc n~noub: e~re pimanna h/p n~q/tf: nem pis~bwt n~se m~peukinwn: e~ta Mwuc~/c mes ]petra n~q/tf.
Hail to the golden vessel / wherein the manna was hidden / and the rod of almond wood / which Moses used to strike the rock.

<ere ke,aritwmen/: w~ ]t~rapeza m~p#n#a#tik/: et] m~p~wnq n~ouon niben: eynaouwm e~bol n~q/tc.
Hail to you O full of grace, / the spiritual table, / which gives life to everyone / who eats from it.
Ø§Ù„Ø³Ù„Ø§Ù… Ù„Ù„Ù…Ù…ØªÙ„Ø¦Ø© Ù†Ø¹Ù…Ø© Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø§Ø¦Ø¯Ø© Ø§Ù„Ø±ÙˆØ­ÙŠØ© Ø§Ù„ØªÙ‰ ØªØ¹Ø·Ù‰ Ø§Ù„Ø­ÙŠØ§Ø© Ù„ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ù† ÙŠØ£ÙƒÙ„ Ù…Ù†Ù‡Ø§.
<ere pikumillion: n~avyarton n~te ]meynou]: e~tervaqri n~ouon niben: eynacw e~bol n~q/tf.
Hail to the incorrupt vessel / which is for the divinity, / which cures all / who drink from it.

I begin eagerly to move / the organ of my tongue / and speak of the honor of this virgin / and her praise.

Je n~yoc gar pe pensousou: nem tenhelpic nem pentajro: qen t~paroucia m~Pennou]: Peno#c# I/#c# P,#c#.
For she is our pride, / our hope, and our affirmation / in the appearance of our Lord / and God Jesus Christ.
